citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
Although the birds at the facility were socially housed and were provided with materials to enhance their environment, a
written plan for environment enhancement to promote the psychological well-being of one Canada goose, one domestic
Emden goose, two chukars, two doves, ten chickens, two red-tailed hawks, and two barred owls had not been developed
and approved by the Attending Veterinarian and was not available for review at the time of the inspection.
Per this Section, exhibitors must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for environment enhancement
to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the Attending Veterinarian and must be in
accordance with currently accepted professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference
guides. At a minimum, the plan must address each of the following: social grouping, environmental enrichment, special
considerations, restraint devices, and exemptions. The facility must develop an environment enhancement plan
appropriate for the species of birds maintained and the plan must be approved by the Attending Veterinarian. Correct by
September 3, 2024.

The water receptacles in the structure housing one Canada goose, one domestic Emden goose, and chickens were noted
to contain dirty water. The larger receptacle contained water that was brown in color, with a large amount of organic
material. The smaller receptacle contained water that was cloudy and green organic material adhered to the side of the
receptacle.
Dirty water may harbor disease and pests and may cause the birds to decrease their intake of water. Per this Section,
potable water must be provided in sufficient quantity to every bird housed at the facility and all water receptacles must be
kept clean and sanitized as often as necessary to keep them clean and free of contamination. Correct by August 23,
2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
